meanings.definition: Strip (something) of its covering, possessions, or assets.
meanings.sent1: The thief denudates the house of all valuables.
meanings.sent2: The hurricane denudates the trees of their leaves.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel denudates the bird feeder of all seeds.
meanings.sent4: The economic crisis denudates the company of its profits.
meanings.sent5: The caterpillar denudates the plant of its leaves, leaving it bare.

meanings.definition: Make (land) bare by clearing or destroying vegetation.
meanings.sent1: The construction project denudates the forest for new buildings.
meanings.sent2: Deforestation denudates large areas of land every year.
meanings.sent3: The goats denudate the hillside, munching on all the grass.
meanings.sent4: The wildfire denudates the landscape, leaving it barren and charred.
meanings.sent5: The farming practices denudate the soil, leading to erosion and loss of fertility.
